channel.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
channel.description:
Facebook trying to control us? Really? http://online.wsj.com/articles/furor-erupts-over-facebook-experiment-on-users-1404085840 http://m.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-28051930
Their explaination: https://www.facebook.com/akramer/posts/10152987150867796
Erm no. They're full of shit.
Thoughts?

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

That’s great psychological evaluation over emotional output. The more stats the better. The content that they sent out shouldn’t have done anything to users besides upset them. They would have been idiots to take out their 12-gauges to bust some caps on FaceBook employees.

Read full topic
item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

Who invited you? You ain’t gonna be a player on my server!

item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:22, topic:544517"][quote author=Ashi link=topic=663395.msg4433704#msg4433704 date=1404285078]
I wasn’t talking about collecting information on what ads you click. It’s the whole idea about how social networking influences your real world choices. Facebook just used adverts to get that across.

Unknowingly you could be doing something that Facebook influenced when in reality you may never have done it.

Take this crummy example which relates to mopar:

Facebooks content led to you guys playing my rsps. Even though it’s shit, lags at 5 players, poor Eco, you’ll still play.

Being able to make people do that is messed up. They’re even saying that there’s like an algorithm for this type of control.

How would you feel that you’re being made do something without realising it?
[/quote]
It is not mind control which is what you seem to think it is. It’s suggestive manipulation, in the end people make their own decisions which means in your example, I would not play your crappy server.[/quote]
Facebook said that they are going deeper into actually making people do things. It’s not just suggestive manipulation anymore.

Mind control is a little over the top though. Giving somebody the though to do something is insane as is but actually getting people to do it? That’s what they’re trying to do. Why else would it be a hot topic. We know that being able to get people to consider things but I guess that’s not enough for some people.

If you did take a rsps as an example:

The advert would be to try get you to play. Taking advertising one step further and making you play without you knowing I had that control over your choice.

A lot can be achieved with just doing that. Imagine an army of derps.

Read full topic
item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote="-Nothing, post:22, topic:544517"][quote author=Ashi link=topic=663395.msg4433704#msg4433704 date=1404285078]
I wasn’t talking about collecting information on what ads you click. It’s the whole idea about how social networking influences your real world choices. Facebook just used adverts to get that across.

Unknowingly you could be doing something that Facebook influenced when in reality you may never have done it.

Take this crummy example which relates to mopar:

Facebooks content led to you guys playing my rsps. Even though it’s shit, lags at 5 players, poor Eco, you’ll still play.

Being able to make people do that is messed up. They’re even saying that there’s like an algorithm for this type of control.

How would you feel that you’re being made do something without realising it?
[/quote]
It is not mind control which is what you seem to think it is. It’s suggestive manipulation, in the end people make their own decisions which means in your example, I would not play your crappy server.[/quote]Most people are mindless drones and don’t understand that concept.

Read full topic
item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Elrick, post:14, topic:544517”]Wait…

They’ll do whatever makes them the most money at the end of the day.

Well actually the research they’ve done hasn’t led them to profit whatsoever. The purpose of this experiment is to find out whether positive acts towards another person gives positive or negative thoughts towards that person. They’ve found that positive reinforcement invokes even more positive enforcement from the viewer. As apposed to the viewer being happier to see negative enforcement on someone else. I guess this proves that people aren’t as heartless as it seems. You could even say people are closer together than we think, and what we do and say does influence the world around us.

Sure it hasn’t been a direct profit right now, but you can’t deny they are trying to find a way to correlate that to ad clicks

I think you’ll have a better chance using a hypnotic spiral to get people to start clicking ads.

If you find someone clicking ads, take their mouse, please. :eek:

What’s this about people seeing ads?

OH WAIT. I use adblocker so I don’t have to see annoying ads anywhere. BWAHAHAHAHAHAHA.[/quote]

I feel so bad for those who haven’t discovered AdBlock.

Read full topic

item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

OP and anyone else that is ignorant to the fact, you realize they’ve been data mining your ass for years now. Hell, the government even BUYS that data. Plenty of people do!

Also, what do you think TV commercials are? People are paid to study how people react to anything and everything. This data is then utilized at the advantage of playing with your emotions. This has been going on for, well, since anyone had any sort of emotion. That’s how people can be sly, charming, persuasive, etc… They’ve studied how people react to different things.

Now, definitely not endorsing it. I think this shit is fucked up. But with every breath you take, there is some information out there wherever it may be, that can be used to make you take that breath differently.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Wait…

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:8, topic:544517”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=663395.msg4433611#msg4433611 date=1404260065]

They’ll do whatever makes them the most money at the end of the day.

Well actually the research they’ve done hasn’t led them to profit whatsoever. The purpose of this experiment is to find out whether positive acts towards another person gives positive or negative thoughts towards that person. They’ve found that positive reinforcement invokes even more positive enforcement from the viewer. As apposed to the viewer being happier to see negative enforcement on someone else. I guess this proves that people aren’t as heartless as it seems. You could even say people are closer together than we think, and what we do and say does influence the world around us.

Sure it hasn’t been a direct profit right now, but you can’t deny they are trying to find a way to correlate that to ad clicks

I think you’ll have a better chance using a hypnotic spiral to get people to start clicking ads.
[/quote]

If you find someone clicking ads, take their mouse, please. :eek:[/quote]
What’s this about people seeing ads?

OH WAIT. I use adblocker so I don’t have to see annoying ads anywhere. BWAHAHAHAHAHAHA.

Read full topic

item.source: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Oh no, facebook is doing something on their site? And they’re controlling you to do it? That’s horrible. We’ll act immediately.

Wait, someone has just informed me that you aren’t forced into signing up into facebook and that, in fact, you do not even have to post on the website.

I don’t see how they’re controlling people or using them like lab rats. Every major site does it. Google does it, anything microsoft, or apple… How do you think they figure out what we supposedly like. By just guessing and spending a couple mill in product design and hope that we like it? No. They either buy the data from another company, or they get the data themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook is using us as their lab rats!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“TabbyKiller, post:7, topic:544517”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=663395.msg4433606#msg4433606 date=1404259773]

They’ll do whatever makes them the most money at the end of the day.

Well actually the research they’ve done hasn’t led them to profit whatsoever. The purpose of this experiment is to find out whether positive acts towards another person gives positive or negative thoughts towards that person. They’ve found that positive reinforcement invokes even more positive enforcement from the viewer. As apposed to the viewer being happier to see negative enforcement on someone else. I guess this proves that people aren’t as heartless as it seems. You could even say people are closer together than we think, and what we do and say does influence the world around us.

Sure it hasn’t been a direct profit right now, but you can’t deny they are trying to find a way to correlate that to ad clicks
[/quote]
I think you’ll have a better chance using a hypnotic spiral to get people to start clicking ads.[/quote]

If you find someone clicking ads, take their mouse, please. :eek:

Read full topic
